<a id="class_RDShaderFile"></a>

# RDShaderFile

**Inherits:** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

Compiled shader file in SPIR-V form (used by [RenderingDevice](class_renderingdevice.md)). Not to be confused with Redot's own [Shader](class_shader.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Compiled shader file in SPIR-V form.

See also [RDShaderSource](class_rdshadersource.md). **RDShaderFile** is only meant to be used with the [RenderingDevice](class_renderingdevice.md) API. It should not be confused with Redot's own [Shader](class_shader.md) resource, which is what Redot's various nodes use for high-level shader programming.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_RDShaderFile_property_base_error"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[String](class_string.md) **base_error** = `""` [ðŸ”—](#class_RDShaderFile_property_base_error)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_base_error**\ (\ value\: [String](class_string.md)\ )
- [String](class_string.md) **get_base_error**\ (\ )

The base compilation error message, which indicates errors not related to a specific shader stage if non-empty. If empty, shader compilation is not necessarily successful (check [RDShaderSPIRV](class_rdshaderspirv.md)'s error message members).

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<a id="class_RDShaderFile_method_get_spirv"></a>

<a id="class_RDShaderFile_method_set_bytecode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->
